support_summary: VCP, along with its cofactors Ufd1-Npl4, targets ubiquitinated Ku80 (XRCC5) to release the Ku70/80 heterodimer that is topologically trapped on DNA following non-homologous end-joining.

functions.cellular_process: After DNA ligation in Non-Homologous End Joining (NHEJ), the Ku80 subunit (XRCC5) of the DNA-bound Ku70/80 heterodimer becomes polyubiquitinated with K48-linked chains. This ubiquitination serves as a signal for the recruitment of the VCP/p97-Ufd1-Npl4 complex. VCP then utilizes its segregase activity, fueled by ATP hydrolysis, to mechanically pull on and extract the entire Ku70/80 ring from its topological entrapment on the DNA, thereby finalizing the repair process.
functions.effect_description: Serves as the ubiquitinated substrate that is targeted by the VCP-Ufd1-Npl4 complex for the extraction of the entire Ku70/80 heterodimer from DNA, a critical termination step of the NHEJ pathway.
biological_consequence: NHEJ completion → Ku80 (XRCC5) is modified with K48-linked polyubiquitin chains → VCP-Ufd1-Npl4 complex recognizes and binds to ubiquitinated Ku80 → VCP's ATPase-driven activity extracts the Ku70/80 heterodimer from DNA → Chromatin is cleared of repair factors, preventing genomic instability
specific_effects: K48-linked polyubiquitination of Ku80 is the specific modification targeted by the VCP-Ufd1-Npl4 complex.
VCP-mediated extraction of the Ku70/80 complex is essential for clearing DNA post-repair and allows for subsequent DNA-dependent processes to occur.
Failure to remove the Ku complex due to VCP inhibition leads to the persistence of repair factors on chromatin.

evidence.paper_title: VCP/p97 Extracts Sterically Trapped Ku70/80 Rings from DNA in Double-Strand Break Repair
evidence.relevant_quote: By means of reconstitution of DSB repair on beads, we demonstrate here that DNA-locked Ku rings are released by the AAA-ATPase, p97. To achieve this, p97 requires ATP hydrolysis, cooperates with the Ufd1-Npl4 ubiquitin adapter complex and specifically targets Ku80 that is modified by K48-linked ubiquitin chains.

mechanism: After DNA ligation in Non-Homologous End Joining (NHEJ), the Ku80 subunit (XRCC5) of the DNA-bound Ku70/80 heterodimer becomes polyubiquitinated with K48-linked chains. This ubiquitination serves as a signal for the recruitment of the VCP/p97-Ufd1-Npl4 complex. VCP then utilizes its segregase activity, fueled by ATP hydrolysis, to mechanically pull on and extract the entire Ku70/80 ring from its topological entrapment on the DNA, thereby finalizing the repair process.
effect: Serves as the ubiquitinated substrate that is targeted by the VCP-Ufd1-Npl4 complex for the extraction of the entire Ku70/80 heterodimer from DNA, a critical termination step of the NHEJ pathway.
summary: VCP activates XRCC5 to modulate dna repair complex disassembly, ultimately affecting chromatin is cleared of repair factors, preventing genomic instability.
